That's how doctors can tell if there's something wrong with your bone marrow. If they can't hear the zuuwee of the scooters, you're gonna die soon. I mean, maybe, I'm not a doctor.

Name: Must Not
Mnemonic: A wing is something you must not do anything with. Wings are fragile (think bird's wings and butterfly's wings) and sometimes dangerous (like the wings of a plane) and you must not touch them, or even go near them! You MUST NOT. You. MUST. NOT. Imagine a pair of wings with a prohibition sign (a red circle with a red line) on them. And next time you see a wing of any kind, think "I MUST NOT"!
ReadingMnemonic: Apart from staying away from wings, the other thing you must not do is eat mochi (もち). Okay, they're not fragile or dangerous, but I love mochi and I don't want you eating them. Now imagine some mochi with red prohibition circles on them. You MUST NOT eat those, do you hear me? Those mochi are mine!

Name: Nearby
Mnemonic: The leader is standing funny, facing a direction nearby. He can't go far because there's obviously something wrong with his feet. He's stuck nearby, very close to your side. Picture the leader very close to your side. He's looking off into the distance, a distance he'll never get to because all he can do is stand there with his messed up feet.
ReadingMnemonic: You decide to bring the leader to a nearby bowling (ぼう) alley. It's really close and you can stay right by his side as he throws bowling balls and gets his anger out. Picture the leader bowling nearby. You keep him close by, you never know when he'll fall over and need your help.

Name: Pleasant
Mnemonic: The soul of the Death Star is actually quite pleasant. And if you think about it, it's the people who control the Death Star that are evil and kill. Picture the Death Star in your mind. As you picture it, its pleasant, smiling soul floats up and out of it. "Oh hello, dear," it says happily, "Didn't see you there!"
ReadingMnemonic: The pleasant soul within the Death Star actually looks like a yurt (ゆ), not a big angry, metal ball. Yurts are very pleasant structures. They're round and soft and moveable, just like the Death Star's soul.

Name: Proceed
Mnemonic: You need to run on your toes if you want to proceed down this road. If you can't run on your toes, well then you're out of luck, and you won't be able to move on at all. I didn't make this rule, I just enforce it. Now run! Imagine trying to proceed down the road by running on your toes. No other part of your foot can touch the ground!
ReadingMnemonic: If you find that you can't proceed, you're a fool (ふ). Everyone can run on their toes. Don't you know that? No? Then you're an even bigger fool, now get outta here! Imagine being called a fool when you can't proceed along the road because running on your toes ends up being super hard to do.

Name: Prosperous
Mnemonic: The sun is the reason why crops grow and people can get out of bed in the morning. But on planets with two suns, they can get even more done and it makes them way more prosperous than us. They work all day, then as the first sun sets, the second one rises and they get a new burst of energy. The whole planet lives in a state of prosperity because of the two suns. Picture the prosperous planet that has two suns. They get so much work done that no one is ever hungry or tired or without.
ReadingMnemonic: The person on this planet with two suns who benefits from the prosperity the most is the Shougun (しょう). Yes, this planet still has a shougun as their leader, but everything is going so well that they didn't see a need to change. The shogun will be in charge of this prosperous world forever. No one ever thinks of revolt when everyone has everything they could ever need. Picture the Shougun looking over the prosperous world, the two suns at his back.

Name: Remorse
Mnemonic: The only feeling a dead soul will have is remorse. Remorse for the people it left behind. Regrets for the things it did and didn't do. If you died right now and left your soul behind, do you think you'd have regrets?
ReadingMnemonic: The soul with the most regrets is Genghis Khan (かん). Everyone knows to stay away from him in the spirit world because he's so sad. Not because of his own actions, but because of the state of his people now. Picture Genghis Khan looking down at the state of his people, the Mongols, in the modern world. See the remorse in his soul's face. They should be leaders of the modern world. Not reduced to a people struggling in the background.

Name: Simple
Mnemonic: You decide to carve a tree into a giant replica of your big toe because you think it will be really simple. Once you're done though, it looks like a really crude attempt at a fat, lumpy blob. Maybe carving isn't as simple as you thought. Imagine carving a really simple, crude toe from a tree. It's your first attempt, so I guess you should have known it wouldn't be great.
ReadingMnemonic: You're admiring your simple looking toe tree when a lumberjack runs up and asks who created it. ぼく, you say. As in "I" said it, in a manly dude, way. He doesn't seem to believe you, so you say it a few more times. ぼく ぼく ぼく! Who carved this simple toe? ぼく!

Name: Stature
Mnemonic: If you put two two pound weights on a person on the moon they'll increase in stature when they come back down. Everything is lighter on the moon so the person won't even feel the weights. Then when they come back to earth they'll have grown a whole two inches taller! Imagine how much height you'd gain if you spent time lifting weights on the moon!
ReadingMnemonic: Getting a taller stature will also make you seem super sexy (せき) on the moon and back home on earth. If you stay on the moon long enough, you'll be the tallest person in the galaxy and who wouldn't find that sexy?! Huh? Imagine how sexy the height of a ten foot tall person would be after just coming back from weight training on the moon.

Name: The Above
Mnemonic: You want to slice what you say in half so that people focus on the above text first. The above is what you want them to see! So slice what you say! Imagine actually slicing the words you say in the air. The above section is what you want people to pay attention to, so you slice a big gap between the above and the below words.
ReadingMnemonic: As you focus on the above words you realize a guy (がい) is trying to push the rest of the things you're saying back up with the rest of them. No! The above text is all that matters! Go away guy! That guy doesn't care if the above is all he's supposed to hear. That guy sucks.

Name: This
Mnemonic: How do you make a mnemonic for the word this? You don’t. But, we can try. You climb many hills. On top of one of the hills is a little drop of water. You pick it up and say “THIS… THIS IS WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR!” As you look at the drop of water, you note that you found the right thing. Written on it is the word “this."
ReadingMnemonic: You collect(これ) this very carefully. You’re going to add this to your drop collection. You’re always collecting drops of water in the hills. It’s your hobby, in fact. But this one is the first one you’ve ever collected with “this” written on it. What a great addition to your drop collection.

Name: Tranquilize
Mnemonic: The reality of gold is that it has the power to tranquilize anyone who gets their hands on it. Gold may seem cool to have in movies and songs, but in reality, it has the power to mess you up! Imagine being tranquilized by the sweet caress of gold coins. You can't even move. You're in a daze or something.
ReadingMnemonic: You've been tranquilized and now drool is running down your chin (ちん). It's actually really gross. But you don't care, look at all this gold! No one will care about your chin when you're rich! If you let gold tranquilize you, you'll drool all over your own chin. Maybe the chins of other people too, who knows?

Name: Urine
Mnemonic: When you go to the pool or lake to swim, you'll see a flag stuck somewhere in the water. That flag is there so you know it's okay to pee in that area of the pool. Everyone knows urine dilutes in water, and if everyone just pees in one place, it won't be gross. So go pee over by that flag when you have to go. Don't bother getting out of the water. Imagine swimming over to the flag that's sticking out of the water and peeing there. Yeah, everyone knows what you're doing over there, but it's better than getting out and walking to the bathroom right? Just pee in the water. Just do it.
ReadingMnemonic: Right as you start to pee, you hear the life guard start to yell, "NYOOOOOO! (にょう)" and he's pointing at you! You were just peeing by the pee flag! Why is he mad? Imagine your embarrassment when you find out that you aren't supposed to urinate in the water, not even by the pee flag, because a life guard yelled NYOOOOOO and pointed right at you while you did it.

Name: VIP
Mnemonic: Between the roof and the ground there are few shellfish. This is because we invited some VIP guests into our home and they ate all our shellfish. The VIPs came into our home (the place between our roof and the ground) where they consumed all our shellfish. Only the best for guests, I guess.
ReadingMnemonic: These VIP guests are part of a Hindu (ひん) envoy. We are treating these VIP guests extra special because they represent the whole Hindu religion. They get shellfish because of course we weren't going to serve them beef!

Name: What
Mnemonic: You're holding a sword in front of two buildings. What will you do? What? Do you think I'm gonna help you make this decision? No way, you need to dig deep and think about what you want to do.
ReadingMnemonic: A. What is, stab the building on the left? You stab the building on the left with your sword and what comes out is... a plate of delicious nachos (な)! What?! You got nachos either way. You should be happy, don't ask me any other questions.

Name: Artisan
Mnemonic: There is a cage with an axe in it above your house to show that you are an artisan. All of the artisans have to have this special sign somewhere near where they live to show they make things. Imagine looking down your street and seeing caged axes above all of the artisans homes and shops. You want a new chair? You want some pants mended? Go to one of those signs and you'll find the right artisan.
ReadingMnemonic: Artisans have to be marked this way because the Shougun (しょう) says so. The Shougun doesn't want to have to put any effort into finding people to make things for him, so he created this new system. Picture the Shougun marching angrily down the street. His shoe suddenly snaps in half. With just one glance he'll be able to find the shoe artisan and make them fix his shoe for free.

Name: Beat
Mnemonic: You're tapping your fingers against a white wall when you realize the sound you're making is actually a sick beat. You keep going and start singing along. Boo boo boop. Boo do do do doop! Finger beats! Imagine yourself in a completely white room. All you have is the white walls, your fingers, and your beats. When you stop all you're left with is white noise. Yuck! Keep those beats coming!
ReadingMnemonic: This beat is sick, but as you tap you realize you're hacking (はく) up the wall! Slowly but surely, your fingers are hacking out little bits of the wall. And the beats don't sound as good until you move to a new, clean white area. Imagine hacking the wall apart as you try to keep this beat going. The music is all you have, man! You can't lose the beat now!

Name: Bind
Mnemonic: Your specialty is dropping people with thread by binding them! You can drop anyone as long as you have enough thread to restrain them. It doesn't matter how much they fight, you'll get them to drop! Imagine if your specialty was dropping people by binding them with thread. You'd be such a weird person.
ReadingMnemonic: If you're going to be a weirdo who likes to bind people, at least make sure that they land on their backs (ばく) when they DO drop. Landing on your head or your boobs really hurts. So please at least try to make them land on their backs! Imagine how you would bind someone so that when they drop they land on their back instead of somewhere more painful. How would you do that?

Name: Bored
Mnemonic: You eat and then wrap yourself into a ball because you're bored. You're also sated, because you ate just the right amount, but now you have nothing to do and it's soooo booooring. Haven't you ever been so bored that you just wrapped yourself up into a boredom ball?
ReadingMnemonic: So now you're bored and stuck at home (ほう). You aren't hungry. There's nothing on TV. And you don't want to have to leave your home to do something, even though that would probably solve your boredom problem. Ehhhhhhgggg guys I'm stuck at home and I'm soooo bored. Heeelpp!

Name: Brushwood
Mnemonic: If you could stop spooning water onto that tree we could use it for brushwood. But if you don't stop, then it will be too wet to burn at all! Stop already! We need to use that brushwood to make a fire! So stop spooning water on it!
ReadingMnemonic: You finally set the brushwood on fire and suddenly a Shiba (しば) Inu jumps out of the flames. So that's why they named this wood after them or... or vice versa? Shiba inu's come from setting brushwood on fire! That must have been how they got their name!

Name: Butterfly
Mnemonic: The insect that is amongst all the world's trees is the butterfly. They are always hanging around trees, those butterflies. Imagine any tree in the world with different kinds of butterflies fluttering around. Then go to another tree in the world that looks completely different. Once again, butterflies! They really are fluttering around every tree in the world.
ReadingMnemonic: As you look at a butterfly, fluttering around a tree, a hand reaches out from the tree and grabs it, then starts plucking the wings off. An evil laugh comes from inside the tree, and you know it's Mrs. Chou (ちょう). She grabs another butterfly and starts pulling off wings again, though this time you can see her evil face looking at you while she does it. "I hate butterflies," she says. "They are always dying in my tea."

Name: Chord
Mnemonic: This bow is mysterious because it's strung with a single chord. I guess that makes the chord both a musical instrument string as well as a bowstring. Pluck the chord and it shoots an arrow while making a perfect G note. So mysterious! So this mysterious bow's string is for plucking a one-note tune or launching an attack. Either way, your enemies will be moved to tears.
ReadingMnemonic: Turns out this bow strung with a mysterious chord belongs to Genji (げん). Of course! Only someone as elegant and dramatic as Genji would own a bow that plays music when you pluck its string. Genji is a lover, not a fighter. Picture Genji, the most handsome and romantic man ever, serenading you with his one-note G-string bow. Swoon! Just hope he doesn't sink an arrow into you too.

Name: Cold
Mnemonic: You're trying to open the lid of a manhole that's covered in ice by jackhammering it a bunch of times but it's not working because it's just too cold. It's so cold that your jackhammer is starting to ice up too. But you need to get this lid open so you try time after time after time! Imagine if it was sooo cold that no matter how many times you tried to jackhammer the ice of the lid for this manhole, it wouldn't crack open.
ReadingMnemonic: Each time the jackhammer hits the freezing cold ice it makes a high pitched ringing (りん) sound. It's actually really annoying to listen to but you really need to crack this ice open so you have to keep listening to it. If it wasn't so darn cold you wouldn't have to hear this horrible high pitched ringing sound because there wouldn't even be any ice to jackhammer through!

Name: Commonplace
Mnemonic: Under this canopy you have a brush (in its 肀 form) and a task to complete with it. This is totally commonplace. This is a totally commonplace thing for almost every class or job you'll ever have. They sit you down under the canopy, put a brush in your hand, and say, "Here, complete this task. I'll be over there."
ReadingMnemonic: This is so commonplace and familiar to you that you finish your task early and eat some yogurt (よう) while you wait for the guy to come back. As you eat the yogurt you think about how commonplace yogurt is too. It's just a normal, plain, boring old food, found in practically everyone's fridge.

Name: Confused
Mnemonic: This was pure gold long ago, but now it's not. Someone got confused and mixed it with something else. You could swear this thing was gold a long time ago. Now it's a mix of different things.
ReadingMnemonic: It's mixed (and not pure anymore) because the confused person put it in that sack (さく) filled with various other things. Since it was in that sack for so long, it just ended up getting mixed with the other stuff in that sack. It was gold a long time ago, but now it's mixed with everything else.

Name: Control
Mnemonic: When you drive a car, everyone under your roof is putting their life in your hands, even if they don't say it with their mouth—it's still under your control. It's really important to remember how many things are under your control when you operate a vehicle. It isn't just the people in your car either, it's everyone and everything in your way too.
ReadingMnemonic: You have to maintain control of your car or you'll hit a bunch of cats (かつ). The roads are full of cats at all times. And if you lose control of your car for just a second, you'll hit at least two or three cats. If you don't want to think about hitting adorable cats with your car, you better maintain control. You're responsible!

Name: Delight
Mnemonic: If you can guard your soul from bad things you'll always feel delight and joy. It's hard to guard your soul from everything though, so take all the joy you can, while you can. Imagine guarding yourself from all the bad things in the world. No more politics, religion, internet trolls debating the two, it's all guarded from your precious soul. Ahhh, it's so joyous to be unburdened.
ReadingMnemonic: The delight you feel is so great that it becomes permanently etched (えつ) in your soul and even your face. Picture joy etched on your own face. No one can get you down.

Name: Destitute
Mnemonic: Put a hole in someone's body with a bow and they'll become destitute. You put a hole in them. They can't work. They can't take care of their house or their kids. They've lost it all. Picture a destitute person wandering in the streets with a hole in their body.
ReadingMnemonic: You see this destitute person and decide to give them a cucumber (きゅう). They don't even remember that they're supposed to eat those, so they shove it in the hole you made with your bow. Picture a destitute person, sitting on the street, holding a cucumber. Putting the cucumber in their hole. Crying.

Name: Esteem
Mnemonic: If when you speak it sounds like the power of a drum is coming out of your mouth, then people will hold you in high esteem. Anyone who has a loud, booming, powerful voice will be held in high esteem in this day and age. Look at all those awesome musicians who have booming voices! Imagine hearing someone speak and it's so powerful and loud that it sounds like they have a drum booming out of their mouth. You'll love them! You'll hold them in the highest esteem!
ReadingMnemonic: You hold them in such high esteem that you give them your car (か). I ... I said you give them your car! Give them your car. Hey, hey! If you hold someone in high esteem you give me your- give them your car. Gimme!

Name: Evil
Mnemonic: Twenty penguins together are always evil. Penguins are seen in groups a lot, sure, but did you know that any time there are exactly twenty penguins in a group they're plotting evil things? Evil things like global warming. And how to eat all the fish in the world so humans can't have any. Imagine walking around in the arctic when you stumble upon an evil group of penguins. They'd be cute if they weren't holding papers with "Kill All Humans" on them and tiny guns in their penguin hands.
ReadingMnemonic: The evil penguins can't let you tell the other human's what you've seen, so they murder you and hide your body in a haystack (へい). Your family will never know what happened to you. The penguins will get away with their evil plans. Only someone or, in this case, something truly evil would kill someone and hide their remains under some hay. That's really disrespectful and, well, evil.

Name: Far Off
Mnemonic: There is a scooter that is a satellite, but it is far off and far away. Look up into the sky. That little moving light is the scooter satellite. It's just scooting along, far away from here.
ReadingMnemonic: The scooter satellite is far off, but you can still hear it's horn go "har (はる) har har." The scooter satellite's only purpose is to make a "har har har" sound that is audible from far away. It's quite obnoxious.

Name: Flood
Mnemonic: A tsunami together with another tsunami is going to cause a massive flood. More than one tsunami will definitely result in a flood. Imagine the floody aftermath of more than one tsunami, arriving together.
ReadingMnemonic: After the terrible flood, Emperor こういち comes to survey the destruction and offer hope to his people. But, instead he just tells the people that this flood happened because they didn't believe in the Crabigator's words, and because they weren't doing their kanji reviews. "This flood was caused by you! It is because you did not believe in the holy Crabigator! It is because you didn't do your kanji reviews. You have sinned, sinned, sinned!" こういち says to the scared, cold, now homeless people.

Name: Gentleman
Mnemonic: Your threads are humble and that makes you a perfect gentleman. You don't have to have fancy clothes to be a gentleman, just humble ones that don't stand out and show off too much. That shows how polite you are. Picture yourself as the perfect gentleman. You may not have a fancy top hat and tie, but you're humble about what you wear and you're kind to everyone.
ReadingMnemonic: Unfortunately, as a gentleman who dresses humbly, you're always getting kicked in the shins (しん) by rude kids (and occasionally rude adults). But you're a gentleman, so you don't kick their shins back, you smile and hold in the pain. No matter how bad your shins hurt, you never fight back!

Name: Give
Mnemonic: You've learned that you can catapult things to give them to other people! Don't catapult rocks at buildings and walls, catapult gifts to the people you love. If you want to give someone something, use a catapult!
ReadingMnemonic: Give food to your new friend Godzilla (ご) with the catapult! You and Godzilla understand each other now. He's just hungry. You give Godzilla old used cars, chunks of old buildings, and sometimes hamburgers. Godzilla is so happy you're giving him food, he doesn't destroy anymore!

Name: Grain
Mnemonic: A samurai hits the foreheads of grains with his weapon so the grains will pop off and into his mouth. He doesn't want to kill the plants, so he's just skimming the grain's foreheads so they'll fall off and he can eat them. Picture the samurai taking out his weapon and spinning in a lightning fast circle. The forehead grains pop off and come raining into his open mouth.
ReadingMnemonic: Phew, all of this grain is making the samurai thirsty, so he reaches in his bag and pulls out an ice cold, refreshing Coke (こく). These grains aren't even cooked, they're just hard and raw, so the Coke really helps wash them down.

Name: In Addition
Mnemonic: Put your fingers in your ears when there's an explosion in addition to all the other things you were told to do. You have to crouch under a desk, you have to stay away from windows, you have to close your eyes. But in addition to that, you need to protect your ears! Pretend you're in a class in the mid-20th century, watching a video on bomb explosion safety. In addition to putting your fingers in your ears, you have to do a bunch of other stuff. You can't just stop after the first step!
ReadingMnemonic: In addition to all the steps you have to take to protect yourself, you can't forget that ears come in sets (せつ). You can't just stick one finger in one ear and have that be the end. You have a set of ears to worry about! In addition to ears, you have a lot of sets on your body to worry about. Sets of eyes, nostrils, legs, you get the picture.

Name: Lonely
Mnemonic: On the roof above, is a small stool. Anyone who sits in that stool will be lonely. Imagine sitting on this small stool, waaaaay up there above the roof. You can't see anyone and you can't talk to anyone. You feel this awful emptiness inside. That's what it's like to be lonely.
ReadingMnemonic: You're so lonely, you make up an imaginary friend: Jack (じゃく). Jack doesn't get rid of the lonely feeling because he isn't real, but he is a distraction at least. You're so busy talking to Jack, you don't hear the voices from below, "Aren't you lonely up there, miss? Do you want us to get a jack to get you down? Hello? I don't think she can hear us..."

Name: Manager
Mnemonic: Your roof is spicy because you're the manager. You're always testing new recipes in your house to share with everyone who works under you, but that makes all the spice stick to your roof (since it doesn't have good ventilation like a restaurant or a lab would). Picture yourself as the manager of a restaurant or a science lab. You have to test all of your managerial methods at home before you can bring them to work. And if you were to lick that roof of yours... it would be spicy from all of your experiments.
ReadingMnemonic: You've finally done it. You're now the manager of a bunch of spicy new cyborgs (さい). You've been toiling away for over a year, but you've finally replaced the cyborg you lost, and now you can manage them properly without anyone getting in the way. Unfortunately, you couldn't figure out how to make non-spicy cyborgs, but that's okay because you're going to be the best cyborg manager ever! No one will ever take them away from you again.

Name: Mausoleum
Mnemonic: The only building you'll get frostbite in is a mausoleum. Mausoleums and tombs weren't made for living people, so they aren't insulated from the cold. No one cares if a dead body gets frostbite. Unfortunately, you're realizing this because you thought a mausoleum would be a good hiding place from the winter cold. Spoilers, it's not.
ReadingMnemonic: You need to escape this mausoleum now but the only way out is on a row (りょう) boat over a creepy frozen pond. You've heard of these mausoleum row boats before, and you're pretty sure they're cursed. Imagine taking your frostbitten fingers and trying to get away from the mausoleum in this row boat. It looks like it was made of bones and it is not very seaworthy. But you row with all your might, because you don't want to end up a permanent fixture in this tomb!

Name: Mediocre
Mnemonic: You go to buy a table but it looks like it has water damage from drops of water hitting it. This makes it a pretty mediocre table. The water drops haven't really damaged it that much, it still stands and you can use it, but it's kinda ugly, so it's just mediocre. You didn't expect to see water drop damage on this table so now your mood is mediocre too.
ReadingMnemonic: You weren't expecting to see such a mediocre table so you go up to the guy who's selling it and say, "Hey, I have a bone (ぼん) to pick with you!" But he doesn't think there is a bone to pick at all, he doesn't think the table is mediocre like you do. Imagine having a bone to pick with someone because they're trying to sell you something mediocre and they just won't listen. Now you have a bone to pick with the person who recommended this guy to you!

Name: Military Officer
Mnemonic: Who loves their flag, using jackhammers, and precise measurements? Your military officer! He's always saluting the flag, jackhammering near all the new recruits to test them, and checking the measurement between the floor and their pants. Who else could it be? Picture a military officer doing all those things.
ReadingMnemonic: That military officer's favorite bird is an eagle (い)! That should be obvious because the eagle is the bird of America! And that's the country he fights for! Picture the military officer saluting as an eagle flies overhead. Majestic.

Name: Peaceful
Mnemonic: Stand staring up at the blue sky and you'll feel more peaceful than you ever have. Blue is a color that promotes peaceful thoughts and feelings. That's why all the social media sites are blue. To stop you from being a jerk. Imagine how peaceful staring at the blue ocean, the blue sky, or the blue tumblr makes you.
ReadingMnemonic: Now if someone asks you if the color blue makes you peaceful you should say "YAASS (やす)!" And you'll have us to thank for that! All those peaceful blue radicals. They're the easiest thing on the site, and if someone asks you if radicals make you feel peaceful say "YAASS" again! YAASS! Peaceful blue radicals standing in a row. What's that? YAASS you do want more radicals added to the site. Well okay then, if it will keep you at peace, sure!

Name: Respect
Mnemonic: When small drops of water work together they gain respect for one another. If you end up working with someone long enough, and they end up being really great, you'll respect them too! Imagine being a small drop of water and seeing other drops of water come to help you by working together. You'd really respect them, right?
ReadingMnemonic: If you respect someone enough you'll even take up their hobbies. The person you respect most loves the Yankees. You don't really feel the same, but you respect that about them so you chant, "Ooh Yankees, Ooh Yankees!" (うやうや) with them during each game. Imagine respecting someone so much that you'll cheer ooh yankees over and over even though they're kind of a crappy team.

Name: Sew
Mnemonic: You take some thread, put your scooter up to a signpost, and sew them together. You don't have a lock, so sewing your scooter up to the signpost to keep it safe is all you can think of. Imagine slowly sewing your scooter to the signpost, passing the thread back and forth through the signpost's metal holes and your scooter's handles.
ReadingMnemonic: You usually only sew at home (ほう), so this is a big exception for you. You're usually worried that if you sew in public people will judge your stitches, so this is a big step for you! Hopefully, if your scooter is still here later you'll be able to start sewing outside of your home more often from now on!

Name: Ship
Mnemonic: A boat that's white isn't just a boat, it's a ship. Boats don't need to be a bright white color. But, ships do! They're dangerous and big, so they paint them nice and white.
ReadingMnemonic: A white-painted ship is a kind of hack (はく). It makes the ship more visible without costing much. You can also imagine hacking the ship's computer. "Look at me, look at me. You are the hacker now."

Name: Squeeze
Mnemonic: If you want to fit your fingers into a key hole, you have to squeeze them in. Fingers aren't exactly supposed to fit in key holes... they're for keys, after all. But you want to squeeze your finger on in there anyway to unlock the door. Imagine what it would be like to squeeze your fingers into a keyhole. Maybe try squeezing one finger really tight first. Did that hurt? Well it's going to be a lot worse in that key hole.
ReadingMnemonic: Once you've squeezed your finger in the key hole to unlock this door you squeeze all the money and jewels and treasures you can fit into your sack (さく). Your stealing sack. You have the ability to squeeze your fingers into locks to open them, so of course you're stealing. And you squeeze those stolen goodies into your sack so you can take them with you.

Name: Still
Mnemonic: An animal with horns is drinking our alcohol? Still? You keep checking outside to see if they have stopped, but they are still drinking. They haven't stopped yet.
ReadingMnemonic: The animal with horns that is still drinking your alcohol is no animal at all. It is actually one of the local youths (ゆう) dressed up like a horned animal so they can drink as long as they want and you'll be too scared to shoo them away. You keep checking, but that youth is still drinking. Of course, you don't know they are a youth, so it's quite impressive an animal can drink this much.

Name: Suffocate
Mnemonic: Take a mole out of its hole and it will suffocate. They need to be in tight quarters, unlike us humans. So when you take one out of its nice, safe hole, it thinks it can't breathe and suffocates. Picture a poor little mole suffocating in your hand after you took it out of its hole. Put it back right away! Don't kill that little mole!
ReadingMnemonic: As the mole suffocates it cheats (ちつ) and shoves its head into your closed hand. You realize what it's doing and squeeze your hand tighter so it's more like a hole. You can feel the mole breathing again now. Unfortunately, you can't use cheats on life, and the mole suddenly stiffens and suffocates to death anyway. You should feel bad about what you've done.

Name: Tombstone
Mnemonic: A stone drops from the sky into a rice paddy and then a cross drops on top of it. They've combined to form a tombstone! Wait, does that mean a body fell from the sky first and you just didn't see it? Imagine seeing a stone and a cross drop from the sky onto each other to form a tombstone right in front of your eyes!
ReadingMnemonic: Now you're curious about what's under there but when you try to touch the tombstone it's radiating with intense heat (ひ)! It must have come from outer space and this heat is from when it entered our atmosphere! Can you feel the heat radiating off this space tombstone? Maybe there's a space skeleton sizzling under there too...

Name: Wisdom
Mnemonic: You shoot an arrow at the mouth of the sun so that it will grant you a gift of wisdom. You heard about a Greek hero doing this and the god in the sun gave him the wisdom to see everything. You're hoping it will work for you too. Imagine shooting an arrow at the mouth of the sun and then waiting for the wisdom of the world to hit you. Did it work? Will you know when it works? Probably...
ReadingMnemonic: You're standing around waiting for the wisdom to hit you when something else does. In the head. Ouch! You look down and it's a wheel of cheese (ち)! At first you're angry, until you realize that this must be a sign. Cheese IS wisdom. And the key to wisdom is eating a lot of cheese! Picture yourself thanking the sun for teaching you that all wisdom comes from cheese. Now take a big bite!

Name: Concave
Mnemonic: It looks like there is a dent in this box. When there is a hole or a dent in something it's called concave.

Name: Convex
Mnemonic: This looks like a box with something sticking out of it. When something is sticking out of something else it's convex.

Name: Blind
Mnemonic: The death of your eyes means that you've gone blind. Imagine what it would be like to have one of your eyes die. You'll be blind in that eye forever!
ReadingMnemonic: When you're blind you probably shouldn't drive anymore because if you do you'll mow (もう) everyone over. Actually, don't mow your lawn either. Blind people probably shouldn't be driving anything. Imagine a blind person mowing over everyone in their car as they drive on the sidewalk. Eeek. At least they don't have to see this mess.

Name: Brew
Mnemonic: An alcohol nurse is someone who nurses alcohol. In other words, they brew it. Imagine a nurse brewing alcohol with the same attention they would nurse a human patient. But this brew is much more important than any person's health.
ReadingMnemonic: A brew of alcohol is what Joe (じょう) loves most after a long day of working the fields. Imagine what it must be like for Joe, out working on the fields all day long, working up a sweat. I’d say he’s earned a cold alcoholic brew after such a day. Cut the man some slack.

Name: Concave
Mnemonic: The concave radical and the concave kanji are the same! Know your radicals, yo!
ReadingMnemonic: If you call someone concave the 王 (おう) will find out and he'll have his guards turn you concave. Watch your mouth around the 王. Have you ever seen a concave person? Yeah that's because they didn't live through it. 王s aren't very nice, you know.

Name: Condolence
Mnemonic: You give a bow and a stick to your friend's family. This is because your friend died, and he loved bows and sticks. You give this to his family, to give our condolences. Imagine looking at the bow and stick as you slide them over to your deceased friend's family. This won't do enough, but it is a little condolence at least.
ReadingMnemonic: More than a condolence, you want to avenge your friend's death. He was killed by Mrs. Chou (ちょう), and she broke his stick and bow, which is why you got the family a new set. Imagine her saying, "My condolences," as Mrs. Chou does him in.

Name: Convex
Mnemonic: The convex radical and the convex kanji are the same, so hopefully you now just know them both. Study your radicals and you'll read good.
ReadingMnemonic: Is this convex? It's totes (とつ) convex! Tote bags are totes not convex though. Don't mix them up.

Name: Crow
Mnemonic: An altered bird is a crow! They look like birds but they're bigger and darker and smarter! See that bird? Wait, that's not just a bird, it's a crow!
ReadingMnemonic: If you can't tell just from looking at it that it's a crow and not a bird, walk up to it and caress (からす) it with your hand! If it caresses you back, it's a crow! If it freaks out and flies away or pecks your face, it's a normal bird. Crows are really smart and like affection. That's what makes them so cool! How many crows have you caressed today?

Name: Daring
Mnemonic: An elf who ventures outside in winter has a lot of daring. Elf ears are very, very delicate, and the winter cold can really mess them up. So if you see an elf adventuring in winter, know that that particular elf is a really daring dude. Imagine how much daring it would take to go outside in winter knowing you could be freezing your precious elf ears off.
ReadingMnemonic: The amount of daring you'd need is about equal to the amount Genghis Khan (かん) had. And he was really daring! Do you think you have the same amount of daring as an elf going out in winter and Genghis Khan? Tell the truth.

Name: Degradation
Mnemonic: When buildings have dirt piling up all around them, it's a sign of their degradation. Picture a street where nothing is maintained. The buildings crumble in the dirt, but the people have lost the will to care. It's not just physical, it's spiritual degradation too…
ReadingMnemonic: And who's leading this charge into degradation? Your dad (だ), of course. Your dad isn't just part of the degradation — he's the ringleader. He's sitting in a broken lawn chair, surrounded by empty beer cans, takeout containers, and piles of dirt. He waves his hand, and more junk food wrappers fall around him, almost like he's commanding this lazy, degenerate lifestyle.

Name: Drum
Mnemonic: You take a drum and a branch and... well, what else would you do? You would drum or beat them together. A branch is just like a drumstick, so of course you're going to drum them together.
ReadingMnemonic: Who loves to drum things together and make a huge racket? 子s (こ), of course. Kids can't get enough of it. Anything that makes a loud drumming noise or anything they can beat together is fun for them.

Name: Equilibrium
Mnemonic: You go to a big rice paddy and establish a prison right in the middle of it to restore the equilibrium of the area. There was a lot of crime right here in this rice paddy, so you just built a big prison right there to lower the crime rate so this region can experience equilibrium once again.
ReadingMnemonic: To restore equilibrium, you throw all the こういち clones into the prison. You might remember from the kanji 耕 that there were こういち clones working in these rice paddy fields. Well, they were the ones disturbing the equilibrium. At least that's what Emperor こういち said. So by throwing them in a prison built right here, the area could once again achieve equilibrium.

Name: Fell
Mnemonic: If the leader of your gang is a drunkard he'll try to have you fell trees thinking they're rival gang members. You all know they aren't but you can't argue with your leader, especially if he's drunk. Go ahead and attack the trees anyway. Imagine felling trees with a bunch of other guys, yelling things like, "This is what you get for stepping on my turf!" It's a little silly.
ReadingMnemonic: As you attack the innocent trees with your chains and sticks, a bunch of bats (ばつ) come flying out and attack YOU! You have your own kind of bats so now you're all trying to fell the bats with YOUR bats! Bats attacking bats. Who will win on this season of Survivor?

Name: Fermentation
Mnemonic: Alcohol is a good teacher on the process of fermentation. Because alcohol is so good and addicting, people will work extra hard to ferment it properly. This makes it a good teacher to learn about fermentation. People are motivated to figure it out!
ReadingMnemonic: Using fermentation, you are indeed making some alcohol. It will be drunk at a party put on by Emperor こういち. You are fermenting thousands of bottles of alcohol for Emperor こういち's big party.

Name: Inspection
Mnemonic: Put a guard at your gate to get a good inspection of your neighborhood going. The guard will stand there all day inspecting everything and then report it all back to you. You won't have to do any of the inspection yourself! Imagine the guard doing his inspection in front of the gate all day long. He should have a nice report for you once he's done.
ReadingMnemonic: His inspection is complete, but it looks like he's used an etch (えつ) a sketch to record all the results. That's not really helpful. If you shake it all the inspection results will disappear! If you hire a guard to stand at your gate and conduct an inspection of your neighborhood, make sure you tell him not to use an etch a sketch!

Name: Intercept
Mnemonic: You're riding your scooter toward your yurt as fast as you can because someone is trying to get in there to boil your water and you want to intercept them. If you manage to intercept them before they can go in there to boil things, you'll be able to pick up all the clothes and comic books you left on the floor. You really don't want anyone to see those.
ReadingMnemonic: You manage to intercept the shaman (しゃ) who was just about to open the door to your yurt, and instead you crash right into him. Phew, you intercepted the shaman in time (though she doesn't look very happy about being scooted into) and now you can clean up your yurt before they go in.

Name: Intestines
Mnemonic: The moon is easy tonight, so you decide to cut it open. But, the moon wasn't the moon, it was your big, pale, round tummy. You just cut it open, and now you can see your intestines. Imagine the moon, then imagine it cross-fading into your big, round tummy. Then, cut it open because you think the moon is easy to cut. And finally, see your intestines as clearly as you can.
ReadingMnemonic: All over the world, people are cutting their bellies open, because they think its an easy moon (versus a normal moon, or hard moon, presumably). This is because they have fallen victim to a spell by Mrs. Chou (ちょう). This scene was in all the omen radicals you've been seeing about her. If only you could have stopped her, then none of this would have happened, right? Perhaps it was all destiny, you think, as your intestines fall from your stomach and Mrs. Chou cackles over your weakening body.

Name: Latter
Mnemonic: Your nose isn't the first thing people see about your face, it's the latter. They see your eyes THEN your nose, then your mouth, in order going down. Just label them A B and C and you'll never forget! Imagine saying A B C as you look down someones face at their eyes, nose and mouth. Their nose is B!
ReadingMnemonic: If you don't have any cereal you have to eat your B breakfast option. Oats (おつ). You don't hate oats, but they're definitely not your first choice. Imagine running out of cereal so you have to eat your latter option of breakfast oats. They aren't awful but they aren't your A breakfast choice, that's for sure.

Name: Maple
Mnemonic: A tree that does well in the wind is a maple tree. Maple trees don't have fruit so the wind can't knock anything off of it. That's why they thrive well in windy places! Picture a bunch of maple trees being blown by the wind. They don't seem upset, they actually seem really happy.
ReadingMnemonic: When the wind goes through the maple tree you know it's kite day (かえで)! Imagine your kite in the maple tree.

Name: Membrane
Mnemonic: If you trap the moon in a greenhouse it will grow a creepy membrane around itself. The moon isn't used to the heat it would be exposed to in a greenhouse so that membrane is there to protect it. It's really gross looking though. Imagine seeing the moon with a membrane sitting stuffed in a greenhouse. It looks like something out of the Alien movies and you're starting to think putting it in there wasn't a good idea.
ReadingMnemonic: You decide to open the greenhouse to check this moon membrane out but when you open the door the smell of big macs (まく) hits you in the face. Eww. Why does this membrane smell like a big mac... or does that mean big macs smell like a festering moon? Can you imagine if the moon had a membrane and it smelled like a big mac? How does that even happen? You should probably go ask that food chain what they use for their ingredients.

Name: Navy Blue
Mnemonic: If you want to turn your thread into a sweet color you just HAVE to go with navy blue or dark blue. That's the sweetest color in existence, everyone knows that. After all, blue raspberry flavor is dark blue and it's super sweet. Turn your thread a sweet navy color and people will be reminded of yummy blue raspberry. MmMmm.
ReadingMnemonic: Now that your threads are navy colored you need to be careful that condors (こん) don't try to steal it for their nests. Condors love dark blue things and thread is perfect for a condor nest. Imagine a condor stealing your sweet navy thread right after you dyed it, flying off. Lame!

Name: Pale
Mnemonic: Flowers grown in a warehouse will be very pale. They never see the sun, so they don't grow to have bright colors. Imagine walking into a warehouse and seeing hundreds of pale flowers growing in it. It's subtle, but beautiful.
ReadingMnemonic: When you grow pale flowers like this, they don't grow a soul (そう). Soul adds color to plants and flowers. That's probably why ghosts and dead bodies are pale too. Picture a bunch of pale, soulless flowers. You pick one up and it falls apart in your hands.

Name: Question Mark
Mnemonic: A drunkard has dirt in his mouth as he tries to talk to you. You walk over and he spits a question mark into your hand. It's covered in dirt and spit. Um... does this mean he's confused? He probably doesn't even know where he is. But how did he make this question mark and why was it in his mouth? Imagine having a drunkard spit a dirty question mark into your hand. You want to say, "Yes, I'm ??? too."
ReadingMnemonic: The drunkard takes the question mark back and presses it to his head. He's wearing a Yankee's (や) cap. Oh come on. "Do you just want to know the Yankee's score in the game?" The drunkard nods. Picture yourself throwing the question mark at the drunkard who only cares about the Yankees. What a waste of time.

Name: Ravine
Mnemonic: To the mountains you took your horned husband for you two to get married. (Society wouldn't accept a horned husband!) To hide even more from the prying eyes of society, you take your horned husband into a ravine. Imagine walking up the mountain in your wedding clothes so you can get married without anyone trying to stop you. Then, because you're still worried, you go into a ravine where you are read your marriage vows.
ReadingMnemonic: The ravine is still in きょうと though, because if you went outside the city your marriage wouldn't be legal. So you found a secluded, local ravine. This ravine runs right through the middle of きょうと, though most people don't notice it. That makes it the best place for a secret wedding to a horned freak-husband.

Name: Robber
Mnemonic: When a shellfish becomes a drunkard and sees a cross, they'll become a robber. Because they'll steal the cross! Some people make really bad choices when they're drunk, and in this case, when a shellfish gets drunk and sees something it wants it'll just rob people for it.
ReadingMnemonic: Once the shellfish has a taste for being a robber, he'll join a Bosozoku (ぞく) bike gang so he can keep stealing more and more crosses. He'll drink more, steal more, and get to ride cool motorcycles. Picture a robber shellfish in a Bosozoku bike gang. Look at him the wrong way and he and his gang will steal all your stuff next time!

Name: Rotation
Mnemonic: Move your coat rack in one direction by shooting it with a gun. Then you can keep shooting it to get a good rotation going. If you think there is a better way to make your coat rack make revolutions, you're probably wrong. Imagine getting your coat rack to make rotations in a circle just by shooting it with a gun!
ReadingMnemonic: As you watch your coat rack's rotations a centaur (せん) barges in and takes the gun from you, stops the rotating coat rack and leaves. How rude! I guess centaurs don't like when things rotate. Picture that centaurs angry face. Convince yourself it was the rotation it didn't like.

Name: Salary
Mnemonic: The leader says spring is looking dry, so you'll need your salary in advance. The leader shows you the number, it's all of your salary for spring. "This way, if things dry up worse, you'll be okay for a while," he says. This is awfully nice, but very suspicious at the same time.
ReadingMnemonic: Your salary is sent straight to your home (ほう) instead of the bank. Okay, something is definitely fishy here. You're sitting at home, and there is a knock at the door. A man in a suit, hat, and dark sunglasses hands you a briefcase full of money. "Here's your spring salary. Enjoy the dry weather."

Name: Scold
Mnemonic: If you put your spoon in the sun while you're in prison, a mouth will appear to scold you. You can never see who the mouth belongs to, but considering you're in prison it's probably a guard. Either way, that person doesn't like what you're doing and they keep scolding you when you put your spoon out into the sun. Imagine trying to reflect some precious sunlight into your prison room with a spoon. Now imagine a mouth appearing in the way of the sunlight and it scolds you.
ReadingMnemonic: One day you finally get fed up. You need to know who the mouth of the person who's scolding you is. You stick your spoon out into the sun and the mouth appears, scolding you right on time. You reach out and grab them. But in your hand is a pile of cats (かつ). WHAT KIND OF WORLD IS THIS THAT YOU'RE IN A PRISON WHERE CATS SCOLD YOU?!

Name: Spread Out
Mnemonic: You have a net of thread for catching a turkey. But, it must be spread out and you must arrange it first. The reason you'd use a net made of thread is because it's hard to see. But, it's only that way when you spread out the net. It's important to spread out and arrange your net otherwise the turkey will see it.
ReadingMnemonic: You spread out your net and arrange it just so. You expect it to catch a turkey, but instead you catch the ancient Egyptian god Ra (ら). "Let me out of this net!" says Ra. "You arranged and spread it out just right so I couldn't see it!"

Name: Sprout
Mnemonic: You have to put flowers in a bright place if you want them to sprout. If they're left in the shade they'll just rot. Picture your flowers sprouting out of the ground in the bright spring sun.
ReadingMnemonic: You want to grow these sprouts in your home (ほう), not outside. So you need to find the windows in your house that are the brightest. Take a walk around your home right now. Can you find the best place to sprout flowers? Remember, it has to be nice and bright! Not dark and damp. Don't put them in your closet.

Name: Tank
Mnemonic: A tree melts into the ground after listening to loud music in the hot sun, so you have to find a nice big tank to scoop the melted tree into. The music made the tree vibrate at juuust the right frequency that it, combined with the hot sun, made the tree turn into a puddle. You can't just leave it being all blobby on the ground, so you find a tank for it. Imagine scooping a melted tree into a tank. It's a very strange sensation.
ReadingMnemonic: You're staring at the big tank when an eerie sound comes out, "Oooh I am the soul (そう) of the tree! You've trapped me in this tank and now I'm going to haunt it!" You don't want to be haunted by a tank with a soul stuck in it. "Um, okay?" you reply to the soul, and walk away from the tank. "W-wait! Tanks can't move? Come back, let me haunt you with my tree soul!"

Name: Two Mat Area
Mnemonic: The amount of dirt you need to get some peace is a two mat area. Two tatami mats, that is. Also called a tsubo, this is a pretty common measurement in Japan, so you should get really familiar with the amount of space that two tatami mats take up together. Picture how big a two mat area is. Lie down and feel the peace this much space brings to you.
ReadingMnemonic: A two mat area also happens to be big enough to hold two bodies (つぼ). That's enough space to bring peace to two living, or dead, bodies! Try to picture a two mat area with two bodies lying in it. Whether they're alive or dead is up to you.

Name: Universal
Mnemonic: Riding a scooter to the library is a universal experience. People young and old have all, at some point, taken a scooter to the library, picked up a book, used the internet, sat in the comfy chairs, then left via that same scooter. Scooters and libraries are universally loved by all!
ReadingMnemonic: Riding a scooter to the library is so universal, even hens (へん) do it. The next time you scoot to the library look around. There are little hen scooters and hens there with their chicks. They're reading them books about grains and how to hatch eggs. It's a universally adorable thing to see.

Name: Womb
Mnemonic: The machine in your body that is powered by the moon is your womb, also called your uterus! Haven't you ever wondered why periods happen with the revolutions of the moon? That's because it powers your uterus and tells it what to do! The next time you're cursing your uterus for making you bleed, curse the moon instead! It's the moon's fault you're in pain.
ReadingMnemonic: It kind of sucks, but there is no way to sever this uterus - moon tie (たい). But if you find a way please tell me, I can't take this anymore. Picture an invisible tie tieing your uterus to the moon. Damn you moon, stop pulling, it hurts!

Name: Accompany
Mnemonic: The building clown is the only clown allowed to accompany you. You hate all clowns, and so does the rest of your town. But this clown is really good at building buildings, and he's allowed to leave his part of town and accompany you while you fix buildings together. I know it's been a long time, but try not to mix this one up with 	部, if you can. Remember, the clown building is in another part of town and the clowns aren't supposed to leave. But the building clown is okay to accompany you through the rest of the city.
ReadingMnemonic: He can only accompany you for so long though and soon it's time to say bye (ばい) again. Wave bye to the clown, he'll accompany you on your building job tomorrow, but right now he has to go home and be with the rest of his clown people. He can't accompany you after dark.

Name: Aid
Mnemonic: Put your fingers on your husband to aid him. There's something about a spouse's touch that just makes you feel better. Have you ever had someone rub your back while you were hurt or sick or sad? It's nice, right? Imagine rubbing your husband's back with your fingers to aid him. You want him to feel better. You want him to get that comforting feeling that this kind of touching gives.
ReadingMnemonic: Unfortunately, your husband wouldn't need your aid if he wasn't such a fool (ふ). He walks into doors, he falls down the stairs, he touches the plate when the waiter says it's hot. And every single time your fool husband hurts himself, you aid him. That's true love, my friend.

Name: Alternate
Mnemonic: When your scooter has a fault, you need to get an alternate. Hopefully your insurance will cover it too. You have a scooter that you drive every single day, but if you notice a fault, you need to send it in to get it fixed. That's when you break out your alternate scooter.
ReadingMnemonic: The alternate scooter is made entirely of 鉄 (てつ). It's hard and cold and not very comfortable when you sit on it. That's why you chose to keep it as an alternate and not as your everyday scooter. Imagine riding on your alternate 鉄 scooter. Feel the hard iron under your bum and the loud sounds it makes as you scoot down the street. I hope your normal scooter is fixed soon.

Name: Chicken
Mnemonic: Your husband was wearing his cleats when he accidentally stepped on a bird. Luckily this particular bird is a chicken, and chickens are really durable! Picture the sad, stepped on chicken. It's angrily clucking and chasing your husband around your yard for what he did.
ReadingMnemonic: The only way to stop the chicken from putting on your husband's cleats and stepping on him to death in revenge is to feed it the cake (けい) you were making. This cake was for your husband, but now he gets nothing. The chicken gets to eat all of the cake in front of him instead.

Name: Congratulations
Mnemonic: The king raked all the mountains down into flat land so he could see everyone in the kingdom from his castle windows. You should share your congratulations with him. Now, quick tell him this was a great idea. Imagine saying "Congratulations!" to a king who just ordered his servants to rake down all the pretty mountains in his kingdom.
ReadingMnemonic: The moment you say "Congratulations!" you've already started to miss (みず) those beautiful mountains. But you can't let missing them ruin your congratulations! Don't let the king know! Imagine how hollow your congratulation sounds when you really miss those mountains. This king doesn't deserve your nice words.

Name: Dawn
Mnemonic: Gamblers usually only see the sun at dawn. They gamble all day and through the night, and if they leave it's at the crack of dawn to get home, clean up, and then go back. I haven't known a gambler who's seen the sun ... well ever! Imagine being a gambler and seeing the bright dawn sun when you come out of the casino or pachinko parlor. It burns your eyes! Evil dawn, get back inside quick!
ReadingMnemonic: If you're up at dawn you'll also see the あか(red) つき(moon). The あかつき only happens as the sun comes up at dawn so usually only gamblers see it. But if you get up early, you can see it too! Imagine getting up at dawn and seeing the あかつき in the sky near the sun. It's so beautiful!

Name: Divide
Mnemonic: A clown takes a knife and divides himself. First he divides himself into two pieces, then he's in four pieces, then... oh why won't he stop?! Instead of dying, the clown divides into slightly thinner clowns.
ReadingMnemonic: The clown finally stops trying to divide himself, and you can't stand to look at all of him. You grab a bowling (ぼう) ball and bowl all of his divided parts over! The many clowns crash to the floor as the bowling ball plows through their... his(?) divided bodies. You can't bear to look anymore.

Name: Endure
Mnemonic: If you touch ice for too long you'll get frostbite and that's a really hard thing to endure. A lot of people can't, and die. Then again, you managed to endure touching ice long enough to get frostbite in the first place, so maybe this is baby stuff for you. Imagine having to endure the pain of frostbite because you were a jerk who put his hand on ice for a few hours.
ReadingMnemonic: The best people in the world at being able to endure the pain are the shinobi (しの) ninjas! They train by hanging out in frozen areas all the time and don't complain at all. Maybe if the pain gets to be too much you can go ask them for advice. Imagine if you were one of these cool Shinobi ninjas that could endure the extreme cold and pain of frostbite!

Name: Fiefdom
Mnemonic: You have to reach a certain number of flowers and tsunamis hits to become a legitimate fiefdom. At least in the old days. If you don't meet one of these conditions, like if you get hit by tsunamis all the time but you only have two or three flowers that will grow, you can't be your own fiefdom. Imagine being the person who has to check whether each fiefdom has enough flowers and tsunamis per year to keep their status.
ReadingMnemonic: The most famous fiefdom checker is Han (はん) Solo. He takes his Millennium Falcon and swoops around checking for flowers and signs of past tsunamis and then he'll either say you can or cannot be your own fiefdom. Thanks Han Solo! Picture Han Solo flying around Japan checking to make sure all the fiefdoms are up to code.

Name: Genealogy
Mnemonic: If you say the lineup of your family members that have lived on this earth under the sun, you're really explaining your genealogy. Say the line up of your family under the sun, then sing some sunny chords to match. You'll know your genealogy and a musical score!
ReadingMnemonic: If you can't tell the difference between your genealogy and a musical score, you're a fool (ふ) and I can't help you. You aren't a fool, are you? You know the difference. Your family genealogy and a musical score aren't even close to being the same thing. Memorize these or everyone will think you're a fool.

Name: Glassy
Mnemonic: The king wants you to make a rocket that looks glassy. It won't be very stable, and it probably won't work, but making it glassy and pretty is the only way to make the king approve. Imagine a king who won't accept a rocket that isn't made of glassy material. He's not very smart...
ReadingMnemonic: You take the glassy rocket and try to stuff some thin reeds (り) inside to support it. But because it's clear and glassy the king sees them at the last second. Picture the king admiring himself in the glassy surface and then his face contorts. He smashes his fist through the rocket and rips out the reeds. "REEDS AREN'T GLASSY!" he cries, and starts hitting you with them.

Name: Graceful
Mnemonic: You can only manage to avoid a tsunami by standing above it on a small stool if you are very graceful. If you aren't graceful enough the tsunami will knock you and the stool over and you'll be swept away like everyone else. Imagine being graceful enough to balance on a small stool above a raging tsunami! Sooo cool!
ReadingMnemonic: No matter how graceful you are, the tsunami still shook (しゅく) the small stool. That's where your gracefulness came in. The stool shook, but you didn't. You balanced yourself and refused to go down. It doesn't matter how badly the stool shook, you stayed graceful and didn't fall!

Name: Greatness
Mnemonic: The leader does a dance on top of the tree to show his greatness to everyone around. If he dances all the way up there on top of the tree, then no one can deny his excellence! "Look upon your leader's greatness!" he shouts, doing a jig around on the branches.
ReadingMnemonic: If you don't recognize the leader's greatness he will throw ketsup (けつ) all over you (it's a special mix of ketchup and catsup). And it's ketsup because it looks like blood. The blood he'll spill if you don't look up and clap at his great dancing. "Oh leader, your greatness is so... great!" you shout up at him. He's holding the ketsup bottle over your head and staring into your eyes as he dances in the tree. He isn't sure if he wants to dump it on you yet. He isn't sure if you really recognize his excellence.

Name: Husk
Mnemonic: A samurai puts his forehead on the table next to his weapon. He is just a husk of his former self. This shell of a samurai has nothing left. He's just sitting there, he can't even pick up his weapon or raise his head anymore.
ReadingMnemonic: The only way to bring a husk of a samurai back to life is to have a cock (かく) crow right in his ear. "Co co co co cooooock!" the cock screams, shocking the samurai back into his lifeless shell. You did it!

Name: Lapis Lazuli
Mnemonic: The king will send his men with swords into your private rice paddy if you come across lapis lazuli. Even though this is your private land, he wants that lapis lazuli to make some new crowns and thrones for himself. Plus he's the king, so he can do whatever he wants. Watch the king's swords digging in your private rice paddy and digging up huge chunks of lapis lazuli. This isn't fair, that lapis should belong to you.
ReadingMnemonic: You run up and ask how this lapis lazuli thievery isn't illegal and one of the swordsmen just shouts, "Loophole (る)!" What? What loophole? What law says that the king gets to steal your stuff? Imagine reading through a giant text called "The Law" and looking for this loophole the king's men claim to have about taking your lapis lazuli. You can't find it... but maybe if you search just a bit longer...

Name: Lock
Mnemonic: This is a gold roof, correct? Better put a lock on it, then. It's only natural that you'd want to put a lock on a gold roof so that nobody could steal it.
ReadingMnemonic: The person who put the lock on the gold roof was none other than... Joe (じょう)?! How did Joe, a simple farmhand, get hold of such a valuable gold roof? Either way, the lock he’s put on it is incredibly tough, so there’s no way you could make off with his gold roof anyway.

Name: Mediator
Mnemonic: A sweet woman sits under a tree and works as a mediator. If you're having a fight with someone, bring them to the sweet woman under the tree and she'll mediate for the two of you. Problem solved! Thanks sweet lady! Imagine the sweet tree woman being a mediator for you and your arch rival. What she says fixes everything between you two!
ReadingMnemonic: You go to pay the woman for being your mediator for you two but she just says, "Bye ばい)." You try to hand her some money and she stares into your eyes. "Bye." Oh... okay, bye then. Imagine her refusing to let you pay her for her mediator services and just saying "bye" over and over until you leave. Weird.

Name: Muddy
Mnemonic: If a tsunami gets into a net that's imprisoning a bunch of insects, the insects are going to get all muddy. The net gets dragged along with the tsunami water and the insects can't escape, so they just get covered in the yucky stuff. Picture a net prison full of insects being dragged by a tsunami getting muddier and muddier. Poor buggles!
ReadingMnemonic: Unfortunately for the insects, these muddy conditions have created the perfect habitat for ducks (だく). And muddy insects already imprisoned in a muddy net is a duck's favorite treat! Picture a bunch of muddy ducks munching on some muddy trapped insects, in some muddy leftover tsunami water.

Name: Pardon
Mnemonic: If you spill something red on yourself in winter you should pardon yourself immediately and try to find something else to wear. It's very dangerous to wear red in winter, and even if it seems rude, make sure you pardon yourself right away and get that taken care of! Imagine spilling red wine or red paint down your shirt. Quickly pardon yourself and get changed now!
ReadingMnemonic: If you don't pardon yourself fast enough the winter shaman (しゃ) will burst in and cast a spell on you, taking away all the clothes that have red on them! Now you have to pardon yourself for being naked! Imagine not pardoning yourself fast enough and having the winter shaman spirit away whatever you got red on. That's embarrassing.

Name: Play
Mnemonic: Throw a drunkard in a cage with a tiger and some spikes and the tiger will have the time of its life playing with them! Think of all the tiger play time possibilities! If you were the tiger how would you play with the drunkard?
ReadingMnemonic: If you aren't the tiger, watching it play is a little like watching someone's head get cut off with a guillotine (ぎ). In fact, you don't want to watch it play at all anymore. What would you rather watch? A guillotine at work or a tiger playing like this?

Name: Receive
Mnemonic: The receive radical and receive kanji are exactly the same. Receive this nice, easy kanji with thanks!
ReadingMnemonic: The best place to receive anything is in きょうと. The city is famous for the quality of everything they make, so if you’re in きょうと, keep your fingers crossed that you’ll receive something. Imagine being in きょうと and receiving something wonderful from a passerby in the street. What did you receive? How does it feel to receive something so great?

Name: Request
Mnemonic: If you want to take a flag out of the mouth of a mantis you have to make a formal request first. Mantises don't like to just give things away, and they're kind of mean so if you try to steal the flag it will probably bite you. So make a formal, polite request if you want it. Imagine trying to request a flag from a scary mantis that has it sitting in it's mouth. Will it give it to you? Will it bite you? You'll have to wait and see.
ReadingMnemonic: After you request the mantis give you its flag it shocks (しょく) you by actually spitting it out of its mouth at your feet. You didn't think your request would work, or even if the mantis understood human speech, but it shocked you by doing exactly what you asked! Imagine your shock at finding out the mantis not only understood your request, but agreed! This is great but also makes you wonder what other creatures can understand you...

Name: Resemblance
Mnemonic: You see a triceratops standing in front of a full moon and you can't help but see a really strong resemblance. The triceratops has that round frill thing behind its horns and it looks just like the round full moon. Who knew that a triceratops would resemble the moon! Look at the triceratops. Now look at the moon. See the resemblance? Uncanny, don't you think?
ReadingMnemonic: The first person to see this resemblance was the Shougun (しょう). That's why he decided to put a triceratops head with the moon behind it on his mon (family crest). Now he's known as the full moon dinosaur shogun, and he's very famous. Imagine being the Shougun and seeing the resemblance between a triceratops and the moon for the first time. You'd put that on all your stuff too, if you were him.

Name: Resent
Mnemonic: You see a soul on a cross covered in flowers with shellfish at its feet and you suddenly resent them. It's not like you want to be the one up there on the cross, but so many people left flowers and shellfish for them. It should have been you... Picture the soul on the cross, flowers all around it and shellfish at its feet. Feel your resentment grow.
ReadingMnemonic: You realize you resent them because it looks like they're having fun (ふん). You aren't having fun, and you wanna be! How dare they have fun when you aren't! You wanna have fun hanging out on a cross with flowers and all the shellfish you can eat. Your resentment grows and grows as you watch the soul having everything you suddenly want.

Name: Rot
Mnemonic: A tree is stuck in a prison under the ground and it's starting to rot and decay. Trees can't live without sunlight, and it's too damp underground in a prison. The water gets all moldy and the tree will rot and die.
ReadingMnemonic: You get close to the rotting tree and see some rotten cucumbers (きゅう) hanging from its branches. No! This poor cucumber tree, left in this ground prison to rot. There's nothing worse than eating a rotten cucumber.

Name: Run
Mnemonic: You're walking down the street when you see twenty big crosses lined up in front of you. Crosses creep you out and this is way too many for you to keep walking so you decide to run as fast as you can to get past them. Imagine trying to run down a street with twenty big crosses lining it. It's so scary that you keep running faster and faster as you go.
ReadingMnemonic: You figure since you're already on the run that you might as well hone (ほん) your running skills while you make your way down this scary, cross lined street. Imagine distracting yourself from the scary crosses by honing your running skills while you do it.

Name: Sail
Mnemonic: You hoist your towel above your table, drop into the water and sail away. You turned the towel into an actual sail and you're balancing on top of the table, which is now a boat. Imagine sailing out into the open sea, drops of water hitting your face, as the towel sail catches the air and carries you away.
ReadingMnemonic: As you sail off into the ocean you hear a familiar voice shout out, "Ahoy!" Han (はん) Solo calls. He's also got a towel sail, but it's on the Millennium Falcon, which is half-submerged in the water. You sail nervously past Han Solo who also seems to be sailing, though in worse shape than you. But he keeps throwing you finger guns so you figure it's best to just sail on and pretend this never happened.

Name: Sedge
Mnemonic: The flowers that grow on your roof that look like a sleeping bear is sedge. Sedge grow all over the world! You've probably seen them before, you just didn't know what they were called! Looks like a green sleeping bear bum, right?
ReadingMnemonic: The next time you see a sedge bite into it. It tastes like sugar (すが)! Luckily, it don't taste like bear. Imagine biting into a sedge flower and tasting the yummy sugary taste. Mmmm.

Name: Serve
Mnemonic: Pour all of your alcohol in the pool to serve all your guests at once! They can all help themselves to as much or as little alcohol as they want! What a great idea! Imagine serving all of your guests their alcohol by dumping it all in the pool! Now jump in and drink all you want!
ReadingMnemonic: As you serve your guests (and yourself) you look over and see Shaq (しゃく) also trying to serve them. And by serving I mean getting served because he's throwing them into the pool. Picture Shaq serving your guests by tossing them into your alcohol filled pool. Thanks, Shaq... I guess.

Name: Sigh
Mnemonic: Deep in your soul, you feel like you want to pull your fangs out by the root, but instead you let out a loud sigh. You're one of the only people you know that has fangs, and it weighs heavily on your soul. Imagine all of the other people staring and pointing, the kids making fun of you, no one seeing you as equal. And just... sigh. Deep down, you want to get rid of your fangs, but you can't do it.
ReadingMnemonic: You sigh again and say, "I wish I was just a normal guy (がい)." I swear the rest of me is a guy like the rest of you. *sigh* Now you're staring in the mirror at yourself. You sigh loudly and take out the pliers. You'll be a guy like everyone else. S-soon. As soon as you can muster up enough strength to stop sighing and rip these fangs out.

Name: Spine
Mnemonic: This tree turkey has been sitting directly on your spine for weeks straight. The pain is starting to become unbearable, and it seems like no one wants to help you. Tree turkeys are absolutely huge, and this exceptionally large one has been sitting right on top of your spine for what feels like ages. Imagine the pain of a huge turkey pressing down on your spine for weeks, perhaps months. How are you still holding on?!
ReadingMnemonic: Just as your spine seems to be getting used to the pressure, the tree turkey unleashes a cry: "TWEET (つい)!" To your horror, a flock of tree turkeys emerge from the trees. You desperately try to escape from the weight of the tree turkey still sitting on top of your spine, but to no avail. The only thing you can see is dozens of tree turkeys approaching to plant themselves firmly on top of your spine, screaming "TWEET, TWEET".

Name: Steal
Mnemonic: You see seven swords just sitting in a hole and so you decide to steal them. They were just left in that hole after all, it's not like anyone was using them. And even if they were, they'll never know you were the one to steal them, right? Imagine seeing seven swords just lying abandoned in a hole. Feel the urge to steal them all. Do it, do it!
ReadingMnemonic: You steal the swords and realize they aren't just seven random swords, they're from the famous sword sets (せつ) they sell online. This particular set is from the Seven Samurai movie. Yes! What a great steal! Imagine your delight as you look up the different sword sets online and realize you happened to steal the best one!

Name: Sulfur
Mnemonic: There are stones that smell like trash in the river. You reach in and realize these rocks are made of sulfur. Even the flow of this water can't hide the stink of these sulfur rocks. If you haven't smelled sulfur before, it smells a bit like rotten eggs. Something that definitely belongs in the trash.
ReadingMnemonic: You throw the sulfur rock as hard as you can, but it hits someone in the back of the head. Oh no, it's Ryu (りゅう) from Street Fighter. You try to apologize and explain that you just didn't want this stinky trash rock, I mean, sulfur rock near you. You didn't know he was there. Ryu looks down at you, holding the sulfurous rock in one hand. Then he uppercuts you with it! Shoryuken!

Name: Below
Mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means below.

Name: Asia
Mnemonic: The kanji and the radical that look like this are exactly the same. They are both Asia. 亜 is associated with Asia because of its あ reading, but sometimes you might see it used as ateji for other place names as well. And don't forget that sub- meaning!
ReadingMnemonic: What's the first sound in Asia? It's A (あ). Nice and easy! A is for Asia!

Name: Barracks
Mnemonic: The barracks radical and the barracks kanji are the same! Know your radicals, yo!
ReadingMnemonic: Barracks are pretty big, so they weigh a ton (とん). And they probably take tons of materials to build. Imagine trying to lift some barracks. They weigh a ton! How are you supposed to do this? Why would you even try to lift something that obviously weighs a couple tons?!

Name: Cape
Mnemonic: You see a mountain in the shape of a turtle shell sticking out into the ocean. It's a cape! No, not the kind you wear, the geographical kind. When you're on land, most capes look like turtle shell mountains sticking out into the sea. Do you know any capes like that near where you live? Picture the turtle shell shaped cape. Feel the salty wind in your hair!
ReadingMnemonic: You decide to walk along this cape because it looks like the perfect place to get rid of your old meat sack (みさき). It's starting to smell, but the ocean breeze from the cape pulls the meat sack out of your hands and off into the sky (then probably into the sea too). The next time you go to the cape, remember to bring your old, used meat sack. You can toss it right into the ocean and it won't bother you ever again! Just make sure no one sees you.

Name: Cast
Mnemonic: Take three measurements of gold and slide them into a mold to make a cast! You'll have cast three gold swords, or goblets, or ducks. Just make sure you follow those directions, or your casting won't come out right. Imagine yourself carefully measuring out the three portions of gold and sliding them into your mold to make a cast of whatever you want. I wonder what it could be?
ReadingMnemonic: You open the cast to reveal your gold statue of Chewbacca (ちゅう)! It's life-size and now you have three! Your new gold Chewbacca casts are going to guard the entrance to your house. Picture your majestic Chewbacca casts. Carefully set them outside your front door to guard you. This was a great idea!
